title: What is the relationship between the love of the Fedeli d'Amore and the mystical literature of Persia and Platonism according to Luigi Valli?
first_phrase: In the following 200 tokens, the author highlights the similarity between the love of the Fedeli d'Amore and the mystical love of Persian literature and the "Cantico dei Cantici". The text discusses the work of Luigi Valli, which shows that the object of this love is active intelligence that captures the potential intellect. The author presents evidence that Dante's "Commedia" places the divine power, supreme wisdom, and first love in a triad that corresponds perfectly to the highest sephiroth. The use of the rose symbol in the tradition of the pagans also has a corresponding relationship with the "loto" of the Eastern traditions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the universal symbolism of the rose, lotus, and woman in various spiritual traditions underscores the concept of transcendence and regeneration. Furthermore, the Aristotelian concepts of active intelligence and possible intellect add depth to our understanding of the integration of human intellect with universal intelligence.
